intro: Schefflera longipedicellata, commonly known as the giant arrow leaf, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves, which can reach up to 1 meter in length, with long, slender leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its striking foliage, it is a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
